Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[ReleasePrep][2024-10-15] RI dev to main" (#10223) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "[Postmortem] Fix json parsing" (#10224) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
There is an issue with parsing lengths (CompressedLength and Length) in json that relates to this incident: https://portal.microsofticm.com/imp/v5/incidents/details/537776118/summary

Check postmortem for more details.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[ReleasePrep][2024-10-15] RI dev to main" (#10223) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "Reverting some packages" (#10222) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The package update from https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/10184 broke deployments. Reverting it until we figure out proper way to update without breaking something.

The [deployment](https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_releaseProgress?_a=release-pipeline-progress&releaseId=1554172) started from this branch was successful.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "System.Text.Json 8.0.4 has security vulnerability" (#13857) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, MSBuild.exe, NuGet.exe, Visual Studio Package Management UI, Visual Studio Package Manager Console, NuGet SDK

### Product Version

latest

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

None

### Repro Steps & Context

NuGet.Client references System.Text.Json 8.0.4: 
 https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/fd6880078a435aa63fb1290e9bc58fb8dea6a4fd/Directory.Packages.props#L8

This version has a security vulnerability:  https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8g4q-xg66-9fp4

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Localization] The strings in “Package Level” column are not localized on the right panel of solution-level PM UI " (#13856) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

NuGet Client Dev\6.12.0.127

### Worked before?

It’s not a regression since it is a new feature. 

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Notes: 

1. The repro rate is 100%.    

2. It’s not a regression since it is a new feature. 

3. It reproes on all loc languages. 
#### Repro Steps:  

1. Create a C# Console App (.NET Core) -- .NET 9.0 projects in VS. 

2. Right-click the solution in the Solution Explorer and select the “Mange NuGet Packages for Solution”.  

3. Go to “Browse” tab and install a package (e.g. “Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore”). 

4. Switch to “Updates” tab and click package “Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore”. 

5. Observe the “Package Level” column on the right panel. 

#### Expected:  

The strings in “Package Level” column (including column name “Package Level” and the value “Top-level”/”Transitive”) should be localized. 

#### Actual:  

The strings in “Package Level” column (including column name “Package Level” and the value “Top-level”/”Transitive”) are not localized as the screenshot below. 
![20241015-toplevel](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/86745513-3f35-4f49-b284-f988415d34d8)
![202421015-transitive](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c9f1f74c-3bc3-4e46-84b3-268f09b8b802)



### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Scream Test Impacting Alpine Linux Customers on 08/20/2024" (#73) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
On **August 20, 2024**, NuGet.org will conduct a **scream test** that may affect **Alpine Linux** customers. The test is scheduled to begin at **EDT 01:00 PM** and is expected to last between **24 to 72 hours**. We will adjust the test duration based on customer feedback.

During the scream test, **Alpine Linux** customers may encounter **DNS failures** from the [V3 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) due to this [issue](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9736). To mitigate, we recommend that Alpine Linux customers migrate to **Alpine Linux 3.18.0** or a newer version. These newer versions support **TCP fallback** in the DNS resolver.

To ensure uninterrupted service during the test, please use the [V2 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) instead.

If you have any **feedback**, **concerns**, or **questions**, feel free to reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: [NuGet/Home#12985](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/discussions/12985).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Scream Test Impacting Alpine Linux Customers on 08/20/2024" (#73) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
On **August 20, 2024**, NuGet.org will conduct a **scream test** that may affect **Alpine Linux** customers. The test is scheduled to begin at **EDT 01:00 PM** and is expected to last between **24 to 72 hours**. We will adjust the test duration based on customer feedback.

During the scream test, **Alpine Linux** customers may encounter **DNS failures** from the [V3 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) due to this [issue](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9736). To mitigate, we recommend that Alpine Linux customers migrate to **Alpine Linux 3.18.0** or a newer version. These newer versions support **TCP fallback** in the DNS resolver.

To ensure uninterrupted service during the test, please use the [V2 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) instead.

If you have any **feedback**, **concerns**, or **questions**, feel free to reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: [NuGet/Home#12985](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/discussions/12985).
